title: Enhancing App Development Practical Skills: Mathematics-Based IT Convergence Projects: Manufacturing and Bio-Sector Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical and computer literacy skills
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can select at least three mathematical algorithms (e.g., linear programming, genetic algorithms, Monte Carlo simulation) for manufacturing process optimization, design and implement a simulation model considering at least five process variables (temperature, pressure, speed, etc.) using Python or MATLAB, and present optimization results with performance improvement metrics of over 15%.

Within six months, learners can implement at least three statistical models (e.g., regression analysis, clustering analysis, time-series analysis) using Python (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy libraries) for bio-data (genomic/protein sequences), and complete a project meeting at least two model performance evaluation metrics (accuracy, F1-score, RMSE, etc.).

Learners can create three types of IT project management documents (e.g., project plan, risk management documents) reflecting information security principles (confidentiality, integrity, availability), achieve scores of over 80% each in peer and instructor evaluation criteria (clarity, security requirement reflection, practicality), and produce 10-minute presentation materials to receive feedback rated "average" or higher from at least five audience members during the presentation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
